title: Prohibits candidates for public office to be voted upon in an election district from being a poll watcher in such district
summary: Prohibits candidates for public office to be voted upon in an election district from being a poll watcher in such district; also prohibits the spouse, parent or child of such candidate from so serving.

       AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to qualifications for poll
         watchers

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  8-500 of the election law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 5 to read as follows:
    3    5. NO PERSON SHALL BE APPOINTED, CERTIFIED OR ACT AS A WATCHER WHO  IS
    4  A  CANDIDATE  FOR ANY PUBLIC OFFICE TO BE VOTED FOR BY THE VOTERS OF THE
    5  ELECTION DISTRICT IN WHICH HE OR SHE IS TO SERVE, OR THE SPOUSE,  PARENT
    6  OR  CHILD  OF  SUCH  A  CANDIDATE.   PROVIDED, THAT NO PROVISION OF THIS
    7  SUBDIVISION SHALL BE DEEMED TO PROHIBIT A CANDIDATE FOR  PUBLIC  OFFICE,
    8  OR  HIS  OR  HER  SPOUSE,  PARENT OR CHILD, FROM BEING PRESENT AT A POLL
    9  PLACE AFTER THE POLLS HAVE CLOSED FOR THE  PURPOSE  OF  DETERMINING  THE
   10  ELECTION RESULTS FOR THE ELECTION.
   11    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1498

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the election law, in relation to qualifications for poll
watchers

PURPOSE:
To prohibit candidates for election or their spouse, parent or child
of such candidate from being poll watchers.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section 1- Amends section 8-500 of the election law by adding a new
subdivision 5 to prohibit a person who is a candidate for any public
office to be voted on by the voters of the election district in which
he or she is to serve, or the spouse, parent or child of such
candidate. However, this shall not prohibit a candidate, his or her
spouse, parent, or child from being present at the close of the polls
to receive the results of the election.

Section 2- Contains the effective date.

EXISTING LAW:
Section 3-400 of the Election Law prohibits candidates and members
of their family from being election inspectors, however, there is no
such prohibition under section 8-500 for poll watchers.

JUSTIFICATION:
The Election Law specifically prohibits a candidate for public office
from electioneering within 100 feet of a polling site. In addition,
candidates, their spouses, children or parents are also prohibited
from serving as election inspectors. However, the law governing poll
watchers does not expressly forbid candidates and their family
members from being poll watchers.

In order to address this ambiguity and to prevent an appearance of
voter intimidation or electioneering, the law should be changed to
prohibit candidates and members of their family from serving as poll
watchers.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2010: S.295, Reported and Committed to Codes; A.7539, Galef,
Election Law
2008: S.6921, Third Reading; A.6921, Galef, Election Law Committee

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None to the State.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
